Constructors

    • new Editor(Object element)

Creates a new Pivot object.

Creates a new Pivot object.

Arguments

elementObject

Required. The html element the pivot table renders in.

Empties the selection (by de-selecting it). This function also emits the 'changeSelection' event.

    • Editor.gotoRow(Number rowNumber, Number column, Boolean animate)

Moves the Caret to the specified row number, and also into the indiciated column.

Moves the Caret to the specified row number, and also into the indiciated column.

Arguments

rowNumberNumber

Required. The row number to go to

columnNumber

Required. A column number to go to

animateBoolean

Required. If true animates scolling

    • Editor.moveCaretTo(Number row, Number column)

Moves the Caret to the specified row and column. Note that this does not de-select the current selection.

Arguments

rowNumber

Required. The new row number

columnNumber

Required. The new column number

    • Editor.moveCaretToPosition(Object pos)

Moves the Caret to the position indicated by pos.row and pos.column.

Moves the Caret to the position indicated by pos.row and pos.column.

Arguments

posObject

Required. An object with two properties, row and column

    • Editor.navigateDown(Number times)

Moves the Caret down in the document the specified number of times. Note that this does de-select the current selection.

Moves the Caret down in the document the specified number of times. Note that this does de-select the current selection.

Arguments

timesNumber

Required. The number of times to change navigation

    • Editor.navigateFileEnd()

Moves the Caret to the end of the current file. Note that this does de-select the current selection.

Moves the Caret to the end of the current file. Note that this does de-select the current selection.

    • Editor.navigateFileStart()

Moves the Caret to the start of the current file. Note that this does de-select the current selection.

Moves the Caret to the start of the current file. Note that this does de-select the current selection.

    • Editor.navigateLeft(Number times)

Moves the Caret left in the document the specified number of times. Note that this does de-select the current selection.

Arguments

timesNumber

Required. The number of times to change navigation

    • Editor.navigateRight(Number times)

Moves the Caret right in the document the specified number of times. Note that this does de-select the current selection.

Arguments

timesNumber

Required. The number of times to change navigation

    • Editor.navigateRowEnd()

Moves the Caret to the end of the current row. Note that this does de-select the current selection.

Moves the Caret to the end of the current row. Note that this does de-select the current selection.

    • Editor.navigateRowStart()

Moves the Caret to the start of the current row. Note that this does de-select the current selection.

Moves the Caret to the start of the current row. Note that this does de-select the current selection.

    • Editor.navigateTo(Number row, Number column)

Moves the Caret to the specified row and column. Note that this does de-select the current selection.

Moves the Caret to the specified row and column. Note that this does de-select the current selection.

Arguments

rowNumber

Required. The new row number

columnNumber

Required. The new column number

timesNumber

    • Editor.resize(Boolean force)

Triggers a resize of the pivot table.

Triggers a resize of the pivot table.

Arguments

forceBoolean

Required. If true, recomputes the size, even if the height and width haven't changed

    • Editor.scrollPageDown()

Scrolls the document to wherever "page down" is, without changing the cursor position.

Scrolls the document to wherever "page down" is, without changing the cursor position.

    • Editor.scrollPageUp()

Scrolls the document to wherever "page up" is, without changing the cursor position.

Scrolls the document to wherever "page up" is, without changing the cursor position.

    • Editor.scrollToRow(Number row, Boolean center, Boolean animate, Function callback)

Scrolls to a row. If center is true, it puts the row in middle of screen (or attempts to).

Scrolls to a row. If center is true, it puts the row in middle of screen (or attempts to).

Arguments

rowNumber

Required. The row to scroll to

centerBoolean

Required. If true

animateBoolean

Required. If true animates scrolling

callbackFunction

Required. Function to be called when the animation has finished

    • Editor.selectAll()

Selects all the text in editor.

Selects all the text in editor.

    • Editor.selectMore(Number dir, Boolean skip)

Finds the next occurence of text in an active selection and adds it to the selections.

Finds the next occurence of text in an active selection and adds it to the selections.

Arguments

dirNumber

Required. The direction of lines to select: -1 for up, 1 for down

skipBoolean

Required. If true, removes the active selection range

    • Editor.selectMoreLines(Number dir, Boolean skip)

Adds a cursor above or below the active cursor.

Adds a cursor above or below the active cursor.

Arguments

dirNumber

Required. The direction of lines to select: -1 for up, 1 for down

skipBoolean

Required. If true, removes the active selection range

    • Editor.selectPageDown()

Selects the text from the current position of the document until where a "page down" finishes.

Selects the text from the current position of the document until where a "page down" finishes.

    • Editor.selectPageUp()

Selects the text from the current position of the document until where a "page up" finishes.

Selects the text from the current position of the document until where a "page up" finishes.

    • Editor.setAutoScrollEditorIntoView(Boolean enable)

Enables automatic scrolling of the Caret into view when editor itself is inside scrollable element

Enables automatic scrolling of the Caret into view when editor itself is inside scrollable element

Arguments

enableBoolean

Required. default true
